events.title: Joan of Arc Captured
events.description: Joan of Arc, the French heroine and military leader, was captured by Burgundian troops during the Siege of Compi√®gne.
events.significance: Her capture led to her trial and execution, making her a martyr and symbol of French unity.

events.title: The Collegiate School of Connecticut Founded
events.description: The institution that would become Yale University was founded as the Collegiate School of Connecticut in Killingworth, Connecticut.
events.significance: Yale University became one of the most prestigious universities in the United States and the world.

events.title: Lindbergh Baby Kidnapping
events.description: Charles Lindbergh Jr., son of aviator Charles Lindbergh, was kidnapped from the family home in New Jersey, beginning a major national investigation.
events.significance: The case led to changes in US laws related to kidnapping and heightened media attention.

events.title: First Indianapolis 500 Race
events.description: The first Indianapolis 500 motor race was held at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway in Indiana, USA.
events.significance: The race became one of the most prestigious automobile races globally, shaping motorsports history.

events.title: First Academy Awards Televised
events.description: The 11th Academy Awards ceremony was the first to be broadcast on television, reaching a limited audience in the Los Angeles area.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of television as a medium for major awards ceremonies and entertainment events.
